name: Dane's Hat
description: The sun-faded and lightly soiled hat of Dryleaf Dane. Worn low over the eyes, it obscures the wearer's vision. Meeting the gaze of another can overcome the senses, often leading to the downfall of those who would walk the noble and solitary seekers' path.

name: Gaius's Helm
description: The black iron helm of Commander Gaius. Part of an armor set patterned after fallen seeds.

name: Oathseeker Knight Helm
description: An Oathseeker Knight helm. Black with gold ornamentation. These knights set off on quests of discovery, hoping to find by themselves an oath of their own choosing to serve in perfect, lifelong devotion.

name: Verdigris Helm
description: Helm made from an unusual metal known as verdigris. Verdigris is said to be the gift of an outer god. Possessed of an enormously hefty yet supple strength thanks to its rusted nature.

name: Pelt of Ralva
description: The pelt of Ralva the Great Red Bear, worn upon the head without modification. Enhances incantations of what is jokingly called "Bear Communion." This untreated hide, won at the end of a bloody bout, is just the thing to make a wild bear out of a warrior.

name: Fang Helm
description: Helm of Red Bear, whose name is lost to madness. The cheek guards are shaped after lion fangs. Perhaps his fascination with the untamed strength of the wild stemmed from his past as a Redmane.

name: Thiollier's Mask
description: A mask upon which is carved a tranquil sleeping face. The silver hair is arranged in the same style as St. Trina's, increasing arcane. Just once, Thiollier was granted the sweet repose of velvety sleep. The remainder of his days would be spent attempting to recapture it.

name: High Priest Hat
description: The hat of Count Ymir, High Priest. The circular design at the top represents the Greater Will and its lightless abyss, imparting increased intelligence and arcane to the wearer.

name: Caterpillar Mask
description: Grotesque mask constructed from countless solidified caterpillars. A ritual implement of the greater potentates of Bonny Village. Used to ward off thoughts of impurity, doubt, temptation, and other wickednesses one is vulnerable to while absorbed in divine ritual.

name: Dancer's Hood
description: Bright-red hood of the Ranah dancers. Enhances the power of dancing attacks. The dance of Ranah is one of burning passion, and the most passionate dancers never allow their fiery dance to end, losing even their names as they dance on. To see the passion fade is to see the dancer's flame extinguished.

name: Helm of Night
description: Bottomless black helm, cool to the touch.

name: Igon's Helm
description: Helm of the broken drake warrior Igon, from a set of armor comprised of a miscellany of parts. This tattered protective-wear is shaped like a bugle. The poor scavenger of battlefields found honor through Dragon Communion.

name: Igon's Helm (Altered)
description: Helm of the broken drake warrior Igon, from a set of armor comprised of a miscellany of parts. Patched with scraps of cloth. The poor scavenger of battlefields found honor through Dragon Communion.

name: Wise Man's Mask
description: The iron mask of Sir Ansbach, giving the appearance of a quiet, wise, old bearded man. But an old fear lurks beneath, together with the cold, unflinching discipline that once honed his blade, now employed to enhance Blood Oath and dynastic skills.

name: Freyja's Helm
description: Golden helm of Redmane Freyja, member of General Radahn's most distinguished knights. A hideous scarlet wound was once hewn into the center of her face. Later, Miquella gently put his lips to it and the unfading scar became the compass that Freyja would thereafter follow.

name: Helm of Solitude
description: Steel helm of the Knights of the Solitary Gaol. Part of a heavy armor set that covers the whole body in overlapping plates of steel. The nameless mausoleums of the realm of shadow are said to hold the spirits of warriors who lost their names, or their hearts.

name: Messmer Soldier Helm
description: Helm worn by soldiers who serve Messmer the Impaler. The iron helm features a visor. Though the engraving upon the forehead is a Scadutree design, it is etched in gold. A small consolation to those forced to wage a war without grace or honor.

name: Black Knight Helm
description: Helm worn by the Black Knights, servants of Messmer the Impaler. Black iron ornamented with gold. A rotten odor stubbornly clings to it. Perhaps it arises from the tainted nature of the blood that splattered upon it. Or perhaps it is the wearer's own blackened soul, festering after endless slaughter.

name: Rakshasa Helm
description: Helm of Rakshasa, soaked in the spurting blood of her victims. Tatters of ragged cloth jut out haphazardly, as if her lust for carnage threatens to break free.

name: Fire Knight Helm
description: Pointed helm of the Fire Knights under Messmer the Impaler's personal command.

name: Death Mask Helm
description: Helm of Wego, elder among the Fire Knights. Two warped death masks stacked one atop the other.

name: Winged Serpent Helm
description: Helm of Kood, captain of the Fire Knights. A winged serpent perches atop it.

name: Salza's Hood
description: Hood of Salza, sage of the Fire Knights.

name: Leather Headband
description: Headband worn by highland warriors, made of woven leather. The white favor represents their home settlement. Highland warriors are known to be hunters of bears; to them, there is no act more glorious than the subjugation of a savage beast.

name: Leather Crown
description: Helm worn by highland warriors, pieced together using leather. The white favor represents their home settlement. Highland warriors are known to be hunters of bears; to them, there is no act more glorious than the subjugation of a savage beast.

name: Death Knight Helm
description: Golden helm of the Death Knights, whose own death masks served as the visards of their armor. Enhances skills and incantations of the capital's ancient dragon cult. The decayed golden wheel that adorns it represents their unbroken loyalty to Godwyn, he who became Prince of Death.

name: Curseblade Mask
description: A mask affixed with a crown of tangled horns, worn by those who would invoke divinity. Divine invocation heightens the dexterity of the wearer, but causes the blessing of the Erdtree to become nauseating, reducing the restorative effect of drinking from a flask of sacred tears. Focus is also troubled by wearing this mask.

name: Messmer's Helm
description: Black helm of Messmer the Impaler, crowned with two intertwined winged serpents.

name: Messmer's Helm (Altered)
description: Black helm of Messmer the Impaler, crowned with two intertwined winged serpents. Slightly enhances incantations of Messmer's fire as well as Fire Knight skills.

name: Gravebird Helm
description: Stone helm with a tinge of green. One of a set of armor pieces cast in the image of the Gravebird. Empowers spells which summon rings of spectral light. Gravebirds are ancient golems, created to guard the spiritgraves built where all manners of Death ultimately drift.

name: Common Soldier Helm
description: Helm of the rank-and-file soldiers of Messmer's army. A pitch-dark soot clings to it, much like the inner faces of the men who wore them.

name: Horned Warrior Helm
description: Helm featuring a crown of sturdy tangled horns, allowing the wearer to invoke divinity. Attire of the horned warriors, keepers of the tower. Divine invocation bolsters the strength of the wearer, but causes the blessing of the Erdtree to become nauseating, reducing the restorative effect of drinking from a flask of sacred tears. Focus is also troubled by wearing this helm.

name: Divine Beast Helm
description: A helm of tangled horn attached to a divine beast mask, allowing the wearer to invoke divinity. Worn by divine beast warriors; the chosen of the horned warriors. Divine invocation heightens intensity of the storm alongside strength and dexterity, but reduces the restorative effect of drinking from a flask of sacred tears. Focus is also troubled by wearing this helm.

name: Divine Bird Helm
description: A helm of tangled horn attached to a divine bird mask, allowing the wearer to invoke divinity. Worn by divine bird warriors; the very first of all horned warriors. Divine invocation heightens the power of divine bird feathers alongside strength and dexterity, but reduces the restorative effect of drinking from a flask of sacred tears. Focus is also troubled by wearing this helm.

name: Rellana's Helm
description: Ornate helm of Rellana, the Twin Moon Knight, fashioned from silver steel.

name: Young Lion's Helm
description: The golden helm worn by Radahn in his younger years. Proudly displaying his heroic red hair, it is fitting attire for a lion. When Malenia, Blade of Miquella, let the rotflower blossom in Aeonia, Radahn heard a murmur in his earâ€” "Miquella awaits thee, O promised consort."

name: Circlet of Light
description: The circlet of light which adorned Miquella's head as he returned in divine aspect. It has begun to fade into nothingness.

name: Shadow Militiaman Helm
description: Helm as dark as shadow, worn by vulgar militiamen. Freshly-singed battlegrounds effusing with the stench of the dead. Forbidden lands that will be excised from the memory of history. What better place than the realms of shadow then, for such an army?

name: Divine Beast Head
description: Ritual headwear in the form of a divine beast's head, used to perform the lion dance. Worn by the very finest of the sculpted keepers. Alas, it no longer responds to the old woman's earnest prayer. Divine invocation heightens intensity of the storm alongside strength and dexterity, but reduces the restorative effect of drinking from a flask of sacred tears. Focus is also troubled by wearing this headwear.

name: St. Trina's Blossom
description: St. Trina's life withered and fell, as fleeting as the seasons. At her last, she left a single water lily. Slightly boosts max FP. Despite the velvety-purple hue, the flower is in no way poisonousâ€”it merely blooms in quietude.

name: Crucible Hammer-Helm
description: Helm worn by Devonia, longest-serving of the Crucible Knights.

name: Greatjar
description: A greatjar which fits comfortably over the head when upturned. Attire of the shamans who perform their worship at gaols. Increases the power of thrown pots of all sizes. They offer their prayers to the innards of the greatjars, such that they might be reborn one day into sainthood. This is the cycle of death and rebirth, taken into the hands of mortal men.

name: Imp Head (Lion)
description: Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem. Resembling a lion in appearance, life force faintly clings to it.

name: Dryleaf Robe
description: Sun-faded and lightly soiled travel attire worn by clergymen. The gold necklace found under the breast belongs to a group of spiritual seekers known as the Dryleaf Sect. This sect rejects dependence on others in all matters of faith, seeking self-discipline and self-sufficiency above all else.

name: Dryleaf Robe (Altered)
description: Sun-faded and lightly soiled travel attire worn by clergymen. The leather satchel hanging from the shoulder is decorated with one of Miquella's emblems, a golden grass motif.

name: Gaius's Armor
description: The black iron chest armor of Commander Gaius. Part of an armor set patterned after fallen seeds.

name: Leda's Armor
description: Chest armor of Needle Knight Leda. Slightly strengthens attacks following a dodge roll or backstep, as well as dash attacks. Embroidered with a golden crossed-tree motif, the chalk white cloak and surcoat symbolize the honor of the Needle Knights. "Kindly Miquella fashioned us as his needles to quell all, to ward away all."

name: Oathseeker Knight Armor
description: Oathseeker Knight chest armor. Black with gold ornamentation. These knights set off on quests of discovery, hoping to find by themselves an oath of their own choosing to serve in perfect, lifelong devotion.

name: Verdigris Armor
description: Chest armor made from an unusual metal known as verdigris. Verdigris is said to be the gift of an outer god. Possessed of an enormously hefty yet supple strength thanks to its rusted nature.

name: Iron Rivet Armor
description: Chest armor of Red Bear, whose name is lost to madness. A vest reinforced with iron rivets. After killing the great red bear in a blood-soaked bout, he became fascinated by the untainted glory of its naked strength. "I wish to be a bear, no more, and no less."

name: Thiollier's Garb
description: The dark attire of those who wield poison in secret. The silver hair is arranged in the same style as St. Trina's, increasing arcane. Additionally, countless needles are sewn onto the exterior, apparently for talismanic effect.

name: Thiollier's Garb (Altered)
description: The dark attire of those who wield poison in secret.

name: High Priest Robe
description: Robe of Count Ymir, High Priest. Conceals the abundance of squirming beneath. Gold embroidery decorates the purple cloth, with a jewelled ruff that sparkles like a flower wet with dew.

name: Finger Robe
description: Robe of Count Ymir, High Priest. The front is open, exposing the squirming fingers beneath. This robe is the image of his fervent desire having broken free, laying bare his greatest wish, and wearing it enhances finger sorceries. "I will be the true mother. My fingers will grant us redemption!"

name: Braided Cord Robe
description: Ragged black cloth overlaid with braided cord. Attire of a vengeance-seeking hornsent. The braided cord ties together the vow of the revenger with the victims' grudges. It must never come undone. Enhances both watchful spirits and the vengeful spirits summoned by horned bairns.

name: Dancer's Dress
description: Bright-red dress of the Ranah dancers. Enhances the power of dancing attacks. The dance of Ranah is one of burning passion, and the most passionate dancers never allow their fiery dance to end, losing even their names as they dance on. To see the passion fade is to see the dancer's flame extinguished.

name: Dancer's Dress (Altered)
description: Altered form of the bright-red dress of the Ranah dancers.

name: Armor of Night
description: Bottomless black chest armor, cool to the touch.

name: Igon's Armor
description: Armor of the broken drake warrior Igon, from a set comprised of a miscellany of parts. Filthy belongings are attached to this tattered piece of protective-wear. The poor scavenger of battlefields found honor through Dragon Communion.

name: Igon's Armor (Altered)
description: Armor of the broken drake warrior Igon, from a set comprised of a miscellany of parts. Patched with scraps of cloth. The poor scavenger of battlefields found honor through Dragon Communion.

name: Ansbach's Attire
description: Attire of Sir Ansbach. The embroidered crest of the Pureblood Knights has now all but faded away. Slightly enhances Blood Oath and dynastic skills. Ansbach understood that keeping his oath to his old master was not an act of logic, nor would it bear any justice, but it was for these very reasons he was unable to let go.

name: Ansbach's Attire (Altered)
description: Attire of Sir Ansbach. Black cloth adorned with gold embroidery. Slightly enhances Blood Oath and dynastic skills.

name: Freyja's Armor
description: Golden armor of Redmane Freyja, member of General Radahn's most distinguished knights. Affixed with a black woolen mantle. After witnessing Freyja's valor as a gladiator in his youth, Radahn invited her to join the ranks of his most trusted warriors.

name: Freyja's Armor (Altered)
description: Golden armor of Redmane Freyja, member of General Radahn's most distinguished knights. After witnessing Freyja's valor as a gladiator in his youth, Radahn invited her to join the ranks of his most trusted warriors.

name: Armor of Solitude
description: Steel chest armor of the Knights of the Solitary Gaol. Part of a heavy armor set that covers the whole body in overlapping plates of steel, and bedecked with a black cloak. The nameless mausoleums of the realm of shadow are said to hold the spirits of warriors who lost their names, or their hearts.

name: Armor of Solitude (Altered)
description: Steel chest armor of the Knights of the Solitary Gaol. Part of a heavy armor set that covers the whole body in overlapping plates of steel. The nameless mausoleums of the realm of shadow are said to hold the spirits of warriors who lost their names, or their hearts.

name: Messmer Soldier Armor
description: Armor worn by soldiers who serve Messmer the Impaler. A ragged cloak is draped over rusted mail. Though the chestpiece features a Scadutree motif, gold has been used for its engraving. A small consolation to those forced to wage a war without grace or honor.

name: Messmer Soldier Armor (Altered)
description: Armor worn by soldiers who serve Messmer the Impaler. The mail has rusted while fighting in unending war. Though the chestpiece features a Scadutree motif, gold has been used for its engraving. A small consolation to those forced to wage a war without grace or honor.

name: Black Knight Armor
description: Armor worn by the Black Knights, servants of Messmer the Impaler. Though the engraving above the heart is a Scadutree design, it is etched in gold. A small consolation to those forced to wage a war without grace or honor.

name: Rakshasa Armor
description: Armor of Rakshasa, soaked in the spurting blood of her victims. Tatters of ragged cloth jut out haphazardly, as if her lust for carnage threatens to break free.

name: Fire Knight Armor
description: Armor of the Fire Knights under Messmer the Impaler's personal command.

name: Fire Knight Armor (Altered)
description: Armor of the Fire Knights under Messmer the Impaler's personal command. Each and every knight hailed from a renowned family of the Erdtree's upper echelons, but were shunned and chased from their homes after pledging allegiance to Messmer as their master.

name: Gloried Attire
description: Traditional garb of highland warriors, made from woven fabric and finished with fur. This garment is made from fabrics with both blue and red patterns. Red-patterned fabrics were allowed only to those who hunted bearsâ€”the greatest and most glorious of the highlanders.

name: Highland Attire
description: Traditional garb of highland warriors, made from woven fabric and finished with a blue patterned cloth. Highland warriors are known to be hunters of bears; to them, there is no act more glorious than the subjugation of a savage beast.

name: Death Knight Armor
description: Golden armor of the Death Knights, adorned with an antiquated depiction of the Erdtree. Enhances skills and incantations of the capital's ancient dragon cult. These knights, once Godwyn's personal guard, quested to find their transfigured master's cadaver surrogateâ€”for the coming age of the Duskborn.

name: Messmer's Armor
description: Black armor of Messmer the Impaler.

name: Gravebird's Blackquill Armor
description: Stone armor with a tinge of green. One of a set of armor pieces cast in the image of the Gravebird. Featuring a cape of black Deathbird feathers, it enhances jumping attacks. Gravebirds are ancient golems, created to guard the spiritgraves built where all manners of Death ultimately drift.

name: Gravebird Armor
description: Stone armor with a tinge of green. One of a set of armor pieces cast in the image of the Gravebird. Gravebirds are ancient golems, created to guard the spiritgraves built where all manners of Death ultimately drift.

name: Common Soldier Cloth Armor
description: Cloth armor of the rank-and-file soldiers of Messmer's army. A pitch-dark soot clings to it, much like the inner faces of the men who wore them.

name: Horned Warrior Armor
description: Armor of the horned warriors, keepers of the tower. The ochre fabric is draped over a chest-piece made to resemble the unclothed form of a hero from older times.

name: Divine Beast Warrior Armor
description: Armor of feted horned warriors chosen to become divine beast warriors, adorned with a lion's pelt. Among the divine beast warriors, only those who truly excel at divine invocation become sculpted keepers, and are granted the honor of the lion dance.

name: Divine Bird Warrior Armor
description: Armor of divine bird warriors, the very first of all horned warriors, made from a golden metal. The golden-hued divine birds are known to be cruel, never taking to human companionship. Those who invoked their divinity were few and far between.

name: Rellana's Armor
description: Ornate armor of Rellana, the Twin Moon Knight, fashioned from silver steel. Adorned with the lapis-lazuli blue that is symbolic of Caria, its radiance is yet to fully fade.

name: Young Lion's Armor
description: The golden armor worn by Radahn in his younger years. Proudly adorned with heroic red accents, it is fitting attire for a lion. When Malenia, Blade of Miquella, let the rotflower blossom in Aeonia, Radahn heard a murmur in his earâ€” "Miquella awaits thee, O promised consort."

name: Young Lion's Armor (Altered)
description: The golden armor worn by Radahn in his younger years. Worn by a fierce lion. When Malenia, Blade of Miquella, let the rotflower blossom in Aeonia, Radahn heard a murmur in his earâ€” "Miquella awaits thee, O promised consort."

name: Shadow Militiaman Armor
description: Armor as dark as shadow, worn by vulgar militiamen. Freshly-singed battlegrounds effusing with the stench of the dead. Forbidden lands that will be excised from the memory of history. What better place than the realms of shadow then, for such an army?

name: Ascetic's Loincloth
description: Attire of the tower's ascetics, embodying their commitment to an austere existence of strict self-control. In order to ascend from their mortal flesh into tutelary deities of the land, they heighten their spirituality through severe ascetic training.

name: Dryleaf Arm Wraps
description: Sun-faded and lightly soiled arm wraps. Wound tightly around the arms as if it might prevent them from being broken.

name: Gaius's Gauntlets
description: The black iron gauntlets of Commander Gaius. Part of an armor set patterned after fallen seeds.

name: Oathseeker Knight Gauntlets
description: Oathseeker Knight gauntlets. Black with gold ornamentation. These knights set off on quests of discovery, hoping to find by themselves an oath of their own choosing to serve in perfect, lifelong devotion.

name: Verdigris Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets made from an unusual metal known as verdigris. Verdigris is said to be the gift of an outer god. Possessed of an enormously hefty yet supple strength thanks to its rusted nature.

name: Iron Rivet Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of Red Bear, whose name is lost to madness. Reinforced with iron rivets. After killing the great red bear in a blood-soaked bout, he became fascinated by the untainted glory of its naked strength. "I wish to be a bear, no more, and no less."

name: Thiollier's Gloves
description: The dark gloves of those who wield poison in secret, ever scorned and loathed.

name: High Priest Gloves
description: Gloves of Count Ymir, High Priest. Soft and well-tailored.

name: Braided Arm Wraps
description: Ragged black cloth tied with braided cord. Attire of a vengeance-seeking hornsent.

name: Dancer's Bracer
description: Metal bracer of the Ranah dancers. Enhances the power of dancing attacks. Designed to protect the sword-wielding hand.

name: Gauntlets of Night
description: Bottomless black gauntlets, cool to the touch.

name: Igon's Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of the broken drake warrior Igon. No more than a mish-mash of tatters and remnants stripped from a corpse found in the aftermath of a battle.

name: Ansbach's Manchettes
description: Manchettes of Sir Ansbach. Black leather adorned with gold embroidery. Slightly enhances Blood Oath and dynastic skills.

name: Freyja's Gauntlets
description: Golden gauntlets of Redmane Freyja, member of General Radahn's most distinguished knights. After witnessing Freyja's valor as a gladiator in his youth, Radahn invited her to join the ranks of his most trusted warriors.

name: Gauntlets of Solitude
description: Steel gauntlets of the Knights of the Solitary Gaol. Part of a heavy armor set that covers the whole body in overlapping plates of steel. The nameless mausoleums of the realm of shadow are said to hold the spirits of warriors who lost their names, or their hearts.

name: Messmer Soldier Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets worn by soldiers who serve Messmer the Impaler, rusted and crusted in filth from fighting in unending war.

name: Black Knight Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets worn by the Black Knights, servants of Messmer the Impaler. Black iron ornamented with gold. A rotten odor stubbornly clings to it. Perhaps it arises from the tainted nature of the blood that splattered upon it. Or perhaps it is the wearer's own blackened soul, festering after endless slaughter.

name: Rakshasa Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of Rakshasa, soaked in the spurting blood of her victims. Tatters of ragged cloth jut out haphazardly, as if her lust for carnage threatens to break free.

name: Fire Knight Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of the Fire Knights under Messmer the Impaler's personal command. Each and every knight hailed from a renowned family of the Erdtree's upper echelons, but were shunned and chased from their homes after pledging allegiance to Messmer as their master.

name: Leather Arm Wraps
description: Arm wraps worn by highland warriors, made of sturdy leather and fastened with winding straps. Highland warriors are known to be hunters of bears; to them, there is no act more glorious than the subjugation of a savage beast.

name: Death Knight Gauntlets
description: Golden gauntlets of the Death Knights, adorned with an antiquated depiction of the Erdtree. Enhances skills and incantations of the capital's ancient dragon cult. These knights, once Godwyn's personal guard, quested to find their transfigured master's cadaver surrogateâ€”for the coming age of the Duskborn.

name: Ascetic's Wrist Guards
description: Wrist guards of the tower's ascetics which embody their commitment to an austere existence of strict self-control. In order to ascend from their mortal flesh into tutelary deities of the land, they heighten their spirituality through severe ascetic training.

name: Messmer's Gauntlets
description: Black gauntlets of Messmer the Impaler. On his mother's wishes, Messmer made himself a symbol of fear, undertaking the cleansing crusade she desired. "Direct thy maledictions, thine ire, and thy grief towards me alone."

name: Gravebird Bracelets
description: Stone bracelets with a tinge of green. One of a set of armor pieces cast in the image of the Gravebird. Gravebirds are ancient golems, created to guard the spiritgraves built where all manners of Death ultimately drift.

name: Common Soldier Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of the rank-and-file soldiers of Messmer's army. A pitch-dark soot clings to it, much like the inner faces of the men who wore them.

name: Horned Warrior Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of the horned warriors, keepers of the tower, made from a thick metal.

name: Divine Bird Warrior Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of divine bird warriors, the very first of all horned warriors, made from a golden metal. The golden-hued divine birds are known to be cruel, never taking to human companionship. Those who invoked their divinity were few and far between.

name: Rellana's Gloves
description: Gloves of Rellana, the Twin Moon Knight, fashioned from quality leather.

name: Young Lion's Gauntlets
description: The golden gauntlets worn by Radahn in his younger years. When Malenia, Blade of Miquella, let the rotflower blossom in Aeonia, Radahn heard a murmur in his earâ€” "Miquella awaits thee, O promised consort."

name: Shadow Militiaman Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets as dark as shadow, worn by vulgar militiamen. Freshly-singed battlegrounds effusing with the stench of the dead. Forbidden lands that will be excised from the memory of history. What better place than the realms of shadow then, for such an army?

name: Dryleaf Cuissardes
description: Sun-faded and lightly soiled travel attire worn by clergymen. Boots made of sturdy leather.

name: Gaius's Greaves
description: Black iron greaves made for Commander Gaius. A cruel joke, for he could not wear them.

name: Oathseeker Knight Greaves
description: Oathseeker Knight greaves. Black with gold ornamentation. These knights set off on quests of discovery, hoping to find by themselves an oath of their own choosing to serve in perfect, lifelong devotion.

name: Verdigris Greaves
description: Greaves made from an unusual metal known as verdigris. Verdigris is said to be the gift of an outer god. Possessed of an enormously hefty yet supple strength thanks to its rusted nature.

name: Iron Rivet Greaves
description: Greaves of Red Bear, whose name is lost to madness. Reinforced with iron rivets. After killing the great red bear in a blood-soaked bout, he became fascinated by the untainted glory of its naked strength. "I wish to be a bear, no more, and no less."

name: Thiollier's Trousers
description: The dark trousers of those who wield poison in secret, ever scorned and loathed.

name: High Priest Undergarments
description: Undergarments of Count Ymir, High Priest. Soft and well-tailored.

name: Soiled Loincloth
description: This lightly soiled loincloth of ragged cloth does little more than conceal one's nether regions.

name: Dancer's Trousers
description: Long, black trousers worn underneath the bright-red dress of the Ranah dancers.

name: Greaves of Night
description: Bottomless black greaves, cool to the touch.

name: Igon's Loincloth
description: Loincloth of the broken drake warrior Igon. Stripped from a corpse found in the aftermath of a battle, this scrap of cloth smells utterly foul.

name: Ansbach's Boots
description: Boots of Sir Ansbach. Black leather adorned with gold embroidery. Slightly enhances Blood Oath and dynastic skills.

name: Freyja's Greaves
description: Greaves of Redmane Freyja, member of General Radahn's most distinguished knights. After witnessing Freyja's valor as a gladiator in his youth, Radahn invited her to join the ranks of his most trusted warriors.

name: Greaves of Solitude
description: Steel greaves of the Knights of the Solitary Gaol. Part of a heavy armor set that covers the whole body in overlapping plates of steel. The nameless mausoleums of the realm of shadow are said to hold the spirits of warriors who lost their names, or their hearts.

name: Messmer Soldier Greaves
description: Greaves worn by soldiers who serve Messmer the Impaler, rusted and crusted in filth from fighting in unending war.

name: Black Knight Greaves
description: Greaves worn by the Black Knights, servants of Messmer the Impaler. Black iron ornamented with gold. A rotten odor stubbornly clings to it. Perhaps it arises from the tainted nature of the blood that splattered upon it. Or perhaps it is the wearer's own blackened soul, festering after endless slaughter.

name: Rakshasa Greaves
description: Greaves of Rakshasa, soaked the spurting blood of her victims. Tatters of ragged cloth jut out haphazardly, as if her lust for carnage threatens to break free.

name: Fire Knight Greaves
description: Greaves of the Fire Knights under Messmer the Impaler's personal command. Each and every knight hailed from a renowned family of the Erdtree's upper echelons, but were shunned and chased from their homes after pledging allegiance to Messmer as their master.

name: Leather Leg Wraps
description: Leg wraps worn by highland warriors, made of sturdy leather and fastened with winding straps. The addition of animal pelt keeps the wearer warm. Highland warriors are known to be hunters of bears; to them, there is no act more glorious than the subjugation of a savage beast.

name: Death Knight Greaves
description: Golden greaves of the Death Knights, adorned with an antiquated depiction of the Erdtree. Enhances skills and incantations of the capital's ancient dragon cult. These knights, once Godwyn's personal guard, quested to find their transfigured master's cadaver surrogateâ€”for the coming age of the Duskborn.

name: Ascetic's Ankle Guards
description: Ankle guards of the tower's ascetics which embody their commitment to an austere existence of strict self-control. In order to ascend from their mortal flesh into tutelary deities of the land, they heighten their spirituality through severe ascetic training.

name: Messmer's Greaves
description: Black greaves of Messmer the Impaler. On his mother's wishes, Messmer made himself a symbol of fear, undertaking the cleansing crusade she desired. "Direct thy maledictions, thine ire, and thy grief towards me alone."

name: Gravebird Anklets
description: Stone anklets with a tinge of green. One of a set of armor pieces cast in the image of the Gravebird. Gravebirds are ancient golems, created to guard the spiritgraves built where all manners of Death ultimately drift.

name: Common Soldier Greaves
description: Greaves of the rank-and-file soldiers of Messmer's army. A pitch-dark soot clings to it, much like the inner faces of the men who wore them.

name: Horned Warrior Greaves
description: Greaves of the horned warriors, keepers of the tower. Shaped to resemble the unclothed form of a hero from older times.

name: Divine Bird Warrior Greaves
description: Greaves of divine bird warriors, the very first of all horned warriors, made from a golden metal. The great, sharp talons increase the force generated by kicks.

name: Rellana's Greaves
description: Ornate greaves of Rellana, the Twin Moon Knight, fashioned from silver steel.

name: Young Lion's Greaves
description: The golden greaves worn by Radahn in his younger years. Worn by a fierce lion. When Malenia, Blade of Miquella, let the rotflower blossom in Aeonia, Radahn heard a murmur in his earâ€” "Miquella awaits thee, O promised consort."

name: Shadow Militiaman Greaves
description: Greaves as dark as shadow, worn by vulgar militiamen. Freshly-singed battlegrounds effusing with the stench of the dead. Forbidden lands that will be excised from the memory of history. What better place than the realms of shadow then, for such an army?
